title: UK Health Secretary tweets people shouldn't 'cower' from Covid, before deleting it and apologizing
content:
1. UK Health Secretary tweets people shouldn't 'cower' from Covid, before deleting it and apologizing  CNN
  2. Sajid Javid apologises for 'cower' Covid remark  BBC News
  3. Sajid Javid apologises for suggesting people must not 'cower' from Covid-19  The Independent
  4. Sajid Javid’s tweet is yet another example of a thoughtless government Covid response – apology or not  The Independent
  5. UK minister apologises for urging people not to 'cower from' COVID  Reuters UK
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
contentSnippet:
UK Health Secretary tweets people shouldn't 'cower' from Covid, before deleting it and apologizing  CNN
Sajid Javid apologises for 'cower' Covid remark  BBC News
Sajid Javid apologises for suggesting people must not 'cower' from Covid-19  The Independent
Sajid Javid’s tweet is yet another example of a thoughtless government Covid response – apology or not  The Independent
UK minister apologises for urging people not to 'cower from' COVID  Reuters UK

localize.title: 英国保健省長官、Covidから「身を引く」べきではないとツイートした後、削除して謝罪
英国卫生部长在推特上说人们不应该对Covid "畏首畏尾"，然后删除并表示道歉
英國衛生部長在推特上說人們不應該對Covid "畏首畏尾"，然後刪除並表示道歉
